Friday, Jan 7

January 7 (Renewables Now) - US independent power company Leeward Renewable Energy LLC has completed the repowering of its 54.4-MW Crescent Ridge wind farm in Illinois to serve US e-commerce giant Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN).

Initially switched on in 2005, the wind farm in Tiskilwa village was powered by 33 NEG Micon turbines with a combined capacity of 54 MW. During the repowering, nine of those machines were decommissioned and four new ones were installed, while 24 legacy turbines were replaced by new hardware. The upgraded project utilises the latest Vestas technology, Leeward said on Thursday.

The repowering project will improve the reliability and performance of the wind farm and lower costs related to its operation. Leeward used USD 92 million (EUR 81.4m) in debt and tax equity funding to implement the plan.

Wells Fargo served as coordination lead arranger, administrative agent, and collateral agent on the project financing and provided tax equity. Santander Bank NA was a joint lead arranger.

Crescent Ridge's output will help Amazon reach its net-zero carbon commitment by 2040 and will support its goal of powering its operations solely with renewable energy by 2025.

(USD 1.0 = EUR 0.885)
